selfIntroduction.title: whoAmI
description: Passionate French developer with a strong ability to learn and adapt. Always eager to acquire new knowledge, I place great importance on optimization: refactoring, process improvement, and clear step-by-step decomposition required to accomplish a task.
I consistently strive to deeply understand what I am doing. Before taking action, I analyze the available options to identify the most relevant and most efficient approach.
I have a strong affinity for Back-End development due to its logical nature, a field in which I feel completely at ease.

journey.title: myJourney
description: I discovered software development during the early days of online forums and the rise of Minecraft. By creating my first forums and configuring Minecraft servers, I found my first true passion for programming. This interest was confirmed in high school when I discovered the C programming language, which naturally led me to join Epitech Paris to pursue studies in computer science.

Due to financial constraints, I was unable to complete this academic path. I therefore decided to focus on my second passion: foreign languages, and more specifically Asian languages. I studied Korean with the long-term goal of working in South Korea as a developer.

After earning a Bachelor’s degree in Korean from the UFR LCAO at Université Paris Cité, I returned to my original career path and trained as a Full Stack Developer, while also obtaining an MBA in Web and Digital Project Management. Through my apprenticeship at BETC, I was able to significantly deepen my development skills and gain a comprehensive understanding of the field, supported by a high-quality IT team, particularly the Lead Developer and Senior Developer, whose guidance was instrumental.

motivation.title: whatDrivesMe
description: Although it can be comfortable to stay within my comfort zone, I actively seek situations that push me beyond it. I enjoy taking on challenges, whether it means traveling alone to the other side of the world to discover a new culture and learn a new language, or starting web projects using a programming language that is new to me in order to broaden my skill set and strengthen existing ones.
I need to be intellectually stimulated to stay motivated and avoid any form of monotony.

lookingFor.title: whatImLookingFor
description: My ambition is to continuously grow while remaining intellectually challenged through diverse projects. I particularly enjoy being exposed to new languages and new cultures, which is why I am open to professional opportunities in Asia (South Korea, Japan, Vietnam, China).

Versatile by nature, I enjoy working on diverse projects that allow me to explore different aspects of development. While my preference clearly lies in Back-End development (Symfony, Django), I am equally comfortable in a dedicated back-end role or a Full Stack position.

passion.title: whatImPassionateAbout
description: I have several passions: video games, Asia with its languages, history, and cultures, software development, and animals.

In the world of video games, I have a particular affinity for MMORPGs. I enjoy the sense of continuous progression they offer, whether it involves optimizing rotations as a DPS or healer, or improving gear to remain competitive. Starting a new MMORPG is, for me, the ideal opportunity to discover a universe alongside other players, while working on the most suitable build for my playstyle to stay near the top of the DPS meter. I also appreciate the strategic depth of dungeons, raids, and world bosses, which require both learning and strong coordination.

My passion for Asia dates back to childhood. I was fascinated by calligraphy, mythology, and the distinctive aesthetics of these cultures. Over time, this curiosity deepened and led me to pursue a Bachelor’s degree in Korean, during which I studied not only the language, but also the history, culture, anthropology, and politics of Korea. My travels are primarily focused on Asia, and I intend to continue exploring this region as long as my desire to learn remains unfulfilled—even if it means returning to the same country multiple times.

Finally, my sensitivity toward animals has been with me since childhood. I once aspired to become a zoologist, but an internship with a veterinarian — during which I observed a surgical procedure — led me to reconsider that path. I nevertheless maintain a deep respect for professions related to animal care. These are essential roles that require particular attention to these majestic beings, whom it is important to protect and care for.

mentions.title: specialThanks
description: I would like to express my sincere gratitude to everyone who has provided support, kindness, or positive influence throughout my journey—whether in my life project, my learning process, or through meaningful collaborations:

• -> Idris C.
  • -> Nirund P.
  • -> David R.
